Annotation.String: This type describes the settings of a resouce.
This type shall describe any attributes of a resouce.
Indicates the time the settings were applied.
The value of this property shall indicate the time that the settings object was applied to the resource.
The ETag of the resource to which the settings were applied, after the application.

The value of this property shall be the ETag of the resource to which the settings were applied, after the application. This is here so that the client can check it against the ETag of the current resource to see if any other changes have also happened to the resource.
Reference to the resource the client may PUT/PATCH to in order to change this resource.
The value of this property shall be the URI of the resource to which a client must do a PUT or PATCh in order to modify this resource.
This is an array of messages associated with the task.
The value of this property shall be an array of messages associated with the task.

This property indicates when a Settings resource can be applied.
A service shall advertise its applytime capabilities using this property as to when a Setting resource can be applied.
This property indicates when the future configuration (i.e. Settings resource) should be applied.
This property shall be specified by client in a request to indicate it's preference on when to apply a settings resource.
This object indicates when the future configuration (i.e. Settings resource) should be applied.
This object shall be specified by client in a request to indicate it's preference on when to apply a settings resource.
This property indicates when the future configuration (i.e. Settings resource) should be applied.
A client shall specify this property to indicate its preference on to when to apply Settings resource.
The value of this property as specified by client to indicate the start time of a mainternance window.

A client shall specify this property to indicate timestamp as to when to start applying the future configuration. This property is mandatory if ApplyTime property is specified as ApplyAtMaintenanceWindowStart or ApplyInMaintenanceWindowOnReset.
The value of this property as specified by client indicates the expiry time of mainternance window(in seconds).

A client shall specify this property to indicate expiry time of a future configuration task. This property is mandatory if ApplyTime property is specified as ApplyAtMaintenanceWindowStart or ApplyInMaintenanceWindowOnReset.
Apply immediately.
Apply on a reset.
Apply during a maintenance window as specified by an administrator.
Apply after a reset but within maintenance window as specified by an adminstrator.
